Oneindia Classifieds Coupons Education News Movies Buy Insurance Auto Cricket Gadgets Lifestyle Money Travel Menu Home News Mobiles Reviews How to Features Top 10 Mobiles Gadget Finder Menu Tip Us!FacebookTwittergplusYoutube News Mobile Tablet Laptop Computer Gear Reviews How To Features Gadget Finder Photos Videos English हिन्दी ಕನ್ನಡ മലയാളം தமிழ் తెలుగు বাংলা ગુજરાતી Home  |  Apps  |  Features  | Android Malware types you really need to be aware of Android Malware types you really need to be aware of Android malware is on the rise and your device could be at risk. By: Samden Sherpa Published: Friday, February 3, 2017, 8:00 [IST] Mobile malware is on the rise and your device could be at risk. These tips could help you stay safe and keep your personal information out of the hands of cybercriminals. Well, if you currently analyze the smartphone market then you can see that the adoption rate of mobile devices has skyrocketed and evidently Android is leading the way. The open-source operating system that has been developed by Google is now found on more than half of all smartphones. In fact, according to a report from Strategy Analytics, about nine in 10 smartphones shipped in the latest quarter ran Google's mobile operating system. In addition, Android accounted for a record 87.5% of the 375 million smartphones shipped in the third quarter, ending September 30, 2016. So you can clearly see from the stats that Android continues to dominate the smartphone market. However, because of its popularity and a massive user base, it has now caught the attention of cybercriminals. Currently, Android mobiles are being targeted by virus and malware developers. Moreover, these malware developers are targeting Android mobile devices to accomplish their goals or illegally obtain personal information from Android owners. SEE ALSO: Android 7.1.2 adds swipe for notifications gesture to Nexus 5X and 6P While this is the present scenario in the Android world, with the advancement of mobile technology, mobile malware and viruses are becoming more advanced and thus are infecting millions of mobile worldwide. On the other hand, it is highly recommended that you stick to apps from the official Google Play Store only. If you do you are unlikely to encounter any of the dangerous malware out there. Just to let you know, malware lives and thrives in unofficial app stores, which are largely unregulated. Having said all that, here are the worst malware types you should be aware of and also keep your mobile away. Stay tuned to GizBot for more updates! Ransomware Ransomware is basically a type of malware that encrypts your files and demands a ransom to be paid off to re-gain access back to your files. An example of ransomware would be an app called Simplocker. Simplocker is basically a Trojan malware that disguises itself as an app suitable for adults only. If Simplocker is downloaded and as it enters your smartphone it scans your smartphone's SD card for documents, images and videos. After the scan is complete it encrypts those files using Advanced Encryption Standard (AES). Then it displays a fake FBI message in Russian that accuses the victim of downloading and viewing child pornography on their device. And to get the files back, Simplocker demands some amount to be paid within 24 hrs. It claims that failing to pay the ransom will result in removing all of the files that it has encrypted. However, it has been said that the app doesn't have the functionality to do so. If you are infected with Simplocker, you can download Simplocker Decryptor that was created by ESET. Another type of ransomware which has gained lot notoriety is the "svpeng", which combines ransomware with credit card theft. Svpeng works by presenting a screen to input credit card details every time a user accesses Google Play Store, which then sends the credit card details to the criminal behind this malware. Moreover, once spveng is on your smartphone, it would check to see whether you have a banking app installed. The good news is the Russian police arrested the creator of spveng in April after he stole more than 50 million rubles ($930, 000) and infected more than 350, 000 Android devices. Mobile Shutting Down Android/PowerOffHijack discovered by AVG, is a type of malware that takes control of the process responsible for shutting down your smartphone. With this malware, your phone appears to be off when in fact it's on and functioning. Interestingly, the malware even plays the shutdown animation to show that your device is really turning off. And what this power off hijack really does is it secretly takes pictures, makes calls, and sends messages while you think that your phone is turned off. On the bright side, this type of malware only affects Android versions under 5.0, requires root access and has been found only on apps outside of Google Play Store. SEE ALSO: 8 tips and tricks you need to change on your new Asus Zenfone 3S Max running Android Nougat Hijacking Malware This malware has currently created a fear among Android users worldwide. According to experts, "HummingBad" has already attacked more than 10 million Android devices worldwide. Dangerously, this malware has the power to take control of devices; it forces users to click advertisements and download apps by using a multistage attack chain. Moreover, the malware tries to gain access to your device through certain websites and infect it. Once it gets through the device it then tries to gain root access to the device by running software. If it succeeds to get the root access, the attackers will gain full access to your mobile. In case if the malware fails to gain root access, it uses a fake system through which it sends an update notification to your mobile to get system-level permission. Viking Horde This virus can be pretty devastating and harmful for your device. Why we say that is because "Viking Horde" has been created for Google Play Store apps. Through these apps, the virus creates a place in Android devices. Moreover, the virus can infect both rooted and non-rooted devices. So, whenever a user downloads an infected app from Google Play Store, the device gets infected by the malware. The risks of rooted devices are bigger compared to non-rooted devices. In rooted devices, "Viking Horde" installs software and executes code remotely to get access to the mobile data. If it does, then the data of your mobile is at risk. The reason behind launching this app is for conducting ad clicks, spam messages, and others. SEE ALSO: Google Nexus 6 and Nexus 9 will not get Android Nougat 7.1.2 update Phishing Apps While mobile browsing of the internet is growing with smartphone and tablet penetration, fraudsters and cyber criminals are now creating mobile phishing sites that look similar to a legitimate service. And with the existence of such sites these attackers are stealing users' credentials or worse. The fact that mobile devices come with smaller screen is making malicious phishing techniques easier to hide from users. As such it is less sophisticated on mobile devices than PCs. Moreover, phishing schemes use rogue mobile apps, programs which can be considered "trojanized", while hiding their true intent as a system update, marketing offer or game. Some of these malware infect legitimate apps also with malicious code which can be only discovered after installing. Malware Symptoms Having looked at the different types of mobile malware, you might have an idea on how they spread and infect devices. While the do come in various ways, they all can produce similar symptoms. Well, signs of a malware infection can include unwanted behaviors and degradation of device performance. Stability issues such as frozen apps, failure to reboot and difficulty connecting to the network are also common. In addition, mobile malware can drain your battery or processing power, hijack the browser, send unauthorized SMS messages, freeze or spoil the device entirely. SEE ALSO: Google rolls out Android Nougat 7.1.2 Developer Preview for Pixel and Nexus phones How to be Safe? So if you are wondering how you can avoid and be safe from such malware then there are several best practices that all mobile users should follow to prevent Android malware infections. In essence, some malware cases may require special prevention and treatment methods, but following these recommendations will greatly increase a user's protection from a wide range of mobile malware. #1 Download apps only from official app stores like Apple's App Store or Google Play. The vast majority of malicious apps are found on unofficial app stores or websites, many based in China or Russia. #2 Do some research on the developer and their reputation. Read user ratings, paying special attention to reviews from disgruntled users, and seek out app recommendations from reputable sources. #3 Think twice before granting "permissions" when installing new apps for the first time. Often, malicious app developers are counting on that level of carelessness to sneak malware onto your device. Always make sure to carefully read the end user agreement before clicking to understand exactly what permissions the app is asking for. Stay tuned to GizBot for more updates! CONTENT Reviews Columns Buyer's Guide POPULAR TOPICS Android Apple Cars Phones Tablets Gaming Computing Photography Apps Software Wearable Entertainment Science Reviews Columns Buyer's Guide Popular Topics  Android Apple Cars Phones Tablets Gaming Computing Photography Apps Software Wearable Entertainment Science Twitter Google+ Facebook Youtube RSS Search SlashGear Search Nexus 5X gets fingerprint swipe, Nexus 6P might follow JC Torres - Feb 3, 2017 0 Facebook Twitter Google Reddit The Android platform is already notorious for its fragmentation and Google may have contributed to that even further. When it launched its own Google Pixel, it introduced some features that may never reach its other Nexus devices, even if the hardware were capable of supporting it. Google’s tune has changed a bit after much criticism, at least for one particular feature. Fingerprint swipe down, first seen on the Pixel, are coming and, at least according to some reports, has already landed on some Nexus 5X devices. Google has been using a hardware excuse for some of the Pixel features it has decided not to provide other Nexus devices. That, however, has largely been debunked and even Google would later admit that the Nexus 5X, and even the Nexus 6P, have capable fingerprint scanners. It was all a matter of updating firmware and software. Google did say it was doable and would investigate the matter. Apparently, they were able to actually make it happen. That’s happening now with the roll out of the Android 7.1.2 maintenance update to the Nexus 5X. A new “Moves” option appears after installing the update, allowing users to roll down the notification panel by simply swiping down on the fingerprint scanner on the back. What hasn’t happened yet, however, is the same update for the Nexus 6P. It would definitely be painful irony if the more powerful Nexus is left out of this feature, which will surely rouse even more vocal complaints. Chances are, the Nexus 6P will follow suit soon. Hopefully. While it’s indeed good that Google has decided to bring the feature down to the Nexus, its implementation is actually quite limited compared to third-party alternatives. Especially when you have a rooted Nexus phone. Now if only Google would do the same for Night Mode. By Katherine Crayonaccess_time 12 months ago chat_bubble_outline5 5/5 (1) Have you ever wondered what plugins do the top WordPress blogs use? What helps them to work smarter, faster and more productively? We have decided to lift the veil of mystery by reaching 14 of the most popular WordPress blogs in regard to their technical side, and provide you with a deeper insight into MonsterPost functionality as a nice add-on. Every now and again, the web audience queries what plugins do the best web resources that are powered by WordPress have installed in their dashboards. While some blogs share under-the-hood lists of their extensions, others either keep this in secret or simply do not think that the web audience might be interested in finding that out. That's why, MonsterPost editorial and our outreach team have joined forces and reached 14 WordPress blogs that we consider to be among the most helpful for the online community with the purpose to compile a list of best WordPress blog plugins. These include WPLift, WebAppers, CodeinWP, WPSuperstars, WPKube, WinningWP, WPBeginner, ShoutMeLoud, WPDailyThemes, TorqueMag, WPMU Dev Blog, FlyWheel, WPTavern, and WPMayor. And, of course, we couldn't have left you without an insight into MonsterPost functionality and added all WordPress plugins that we use on the list as well. In order to make it easier for you to run though this pretty long list of 98 top WordPress plugins for blogs, we have decided to divide them all into two big groups: Plugins that are used more often than others >> Plugins that are used by individual blogs >> What's more, we have organized all plugins in both groups by categories into the usable tables of contest, thus making it easier for you to reach the desired part with a click. Plugins that are used more often than others Site Performance Optimization WordPress Plugins >> Navigation WordPress Plugins >> Security WordPress Plugins >> Comments WordPress Plugins >> Contact Form WordPress plugins >> Email WordPress Plugins >> Social Media WordPress Plugins >> WordPress Plugins for Other Purposes >> * * * Site Performance Optimization WordPress Plugins Download QR-Code Redirection Developer: John Godley Price: Free Installed on: WPLift, ShoutMeLoud, WMPU Dev blog, FlyWHeel, and WinningWP Use it for projects that are migrating from an old website or change the directory of their WordPress installation. Also, the plugin helps WordPress blogs to keep their readers who have accidentally reached the old content while redirecting them to the new or updated one. The plugin captures the log of 404 errors and maps those to 301 redirects. 3 main redirection methods: redirect based on the users' login status, redirect to random pages, redirect based on the referrer 404 error monitoring Full logs for all redirected URLs Redirection statistics on the quantity of times that a redirect has occurred Fully localized *** Download QR-Code Crayon Syntax Highlighter Developer: akarmenia Price: Free Installed on: TorqueMag, WPMU Dev Blog, WPKube, WinningWP, and WPBeginner Use it to highlight both URL and WordPress post texts. Once installed, the plugin can be fully customized as per your personal requirements. On top of that, it provides regular expressions and support for multiple languages. Integrated Theme Editor and Tag Editor bbPress 2 support Remote request caching Mobile/touchscreen device detection Live Preview in settings Dimensions, margins, alignment, font-size, line-height, float Extensive error logging *** Download QR-Code Jetpack by WordPress.com Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: CodeinWP, ShoutMeLoud, WPMU Dev Blog, WinningWP, and WPTavern This is all about seamless and convenient centralized site management. Use it to take control of posts and plugins on your WordPress site any time to wish. In addition, Jetpack offers a plethora of features that are intended to speed up the image performance, secure your site from the malware of any kind, edit and publish blog posts, etc. Centralized site management Traffic growth tracker Malware protection Image performance optimization *** Download QR-Code W3 Total Cache Developer: Frederick Townes Price: Free Installed on: WPSuperstars, WPMU Dev Blog and WPBeginner This is a great option if you are looking for a free WordPress plugin to enhance page loading speeds and improve the users' experience. W3 Total Cache is intended to increase server performance while reducing the download times and providing integration of transparent content delivery network. As per the plugin's developers, any site that has it integrated into the dashboard is guaranteed to have 10x higher page speed, quicker page rendering, improved server performance, up to 80% bandwidth savings, etc. This is not the easiest plugin to setup. However, if you decide to add it to your dashboard, here is a detailed step-by-step guide that will help you install and manage the plugin on your own. Compatibility: shared hosting, virtual private / dedicated servers, dedicated servers / clusters Transparent content delivery network management Caching of minified and compressed pages, posts, CSS, JacaScript, feeds, search results pages, and database objects in memory or on disk *** Installed on: WPLift, WPMU Dev Blog, WPKube, and WPBeginner One of the best reasons to use MaxCDN is its seamless integration into WordPress. According to WPBeginner, the integration of the plugin has provided some sites with up to 350% better page performance. Faster page loading ensures higher ranking in Google search results and lower bounce rate. On top of that, website that have MaxCDN installed in their dashboards are more crash resistant. Realtime control over your network/SSL Integration/Reporting Realtime analytics with logs and realtime reporting Making your account secure by means of the 2-step authentication *** Download QR-Code Google Analytics Developer: ShareThis Price: Free Installed on: WPKube, WinningWP and WPBeginner This is the ultimate solution that allows you to have a better understanding of how the audience understands your site, what they like/dislike on your page, what browser/device/search engine did they use to reach you, etc. In a word, Google Analytics is the preferred freebie of the users who want to have a better understanding about their target audience browsing behavior. Shows who visits your site, their geographical location, what language they speak, what browser they use, etc. Reveals what people do on your site and for how long they stay on your pages Provides a deeper insight regarding the time when they reach your site and via which search engine they managed to find you Shows how people interact with your content, etc. *** Installed on: WPKube, ShoutMeLoud and WPSuperstars Use SumoMe to grow your site's traffic, discover where the users click on your page, what they read and share with others. The plugin includes an array of apps that are all intended to grow your site's traffic, including Content Analytics, Image Sharer, Welcome Mat, Scroll Box, Highlighter, Smart Bar, etc. List builder will help you turn one-time visitors into your loyal subscribers. Heatmaps functionality tells where exactly people click on your site. Share option allows the users to spread the word about your content with their friends, followers, colleagues, etc. in a simple and intuitive way. * * * Navigation WordPress Plugins *** Download QR-Code Swiftype Search Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: WPMU Dev Blog and WPTavern Use this plugin to make your search results more relevant and re-order specific search results within a drag and drop interface in the plugin's dashboard. To use it, you do not need to have any specific coding skills, as Swiftype Search was made intuitive in installation and customization. Simple drag'n'drop interface to manage the ordering of search results on your blog Includes detailed search keywords analytics and improved keyword-based relevance algorithm * * * Security WordPress Plugins Download QR-Code VaultPress Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: CodeinWP, WPSuperstars, ShoutMeLoud, WPDailyThemes, WinningWP, and WPBeginner With VaultPress you may be certain that all your posts, images, videos, themes, plugins, drafts, site settings, comments, and so much more will be kept safe and secure. While connecting your WordPress site to the VaultPress servers, the plugin makes it possible to make an up-to-date backup of all your site's data, including both daily and realtime syncing of all your WordPress content. In order to ensure the high level of transparence, VaultPress performs daily security scans and provides you with access to fix threats. Realtime backup activity monitoring Scanning sites for threats daily Automatic backups restore Daily security scans Browse and download a backup *** Download QR-Code Sucuri Security - Auditing, Malware Scanner and Security Hardening Developer: Daniel Cid Price: Free Installed on: WPLift, CodeinWP, WPDailyThemes, WinningWP, and WPBeginner Sucuri is a world's recognized plugin specializing in WordPress security. When installed on one site together with the VaultPress, these two options make up a perfect combination. While the latter will take care of backing up all the site's content, Sucuri will run a deep scanning of your site to ensure that it is free from malware of any kind every three hours, from both back-end and front-end. One of the best parts of the plugin are its notifications. As soon as the system configures Twitter, email, SMS, RSS or IM alerts, the site's owner gets automatically notified. Security Activity Auditing File Integrity Monitoring Remote Malware Scanning Blacklist Monitoring Effective Security Hardening Post-Hack Security Actions Security Notifications * * * Comments WordPress Plugins Download QR-Code Akismet Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: WPlift, CodeinWP, WPDailyThemes, WPBeginner Use it to filter all comments that are left on your site by those that look like spam and the ones that don't. Also, the plugin provides access to all the spammy comments, which are stored in the 'comments' section in the dashboard. Automatically checks and filters spam. As a moderator, you can see the number of approved comments for each user. Each comment has a status history. *** Download QR-Code Disqus Comment System Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: MonsterPost, WPTavern, Torguemag, WinningWP, and CodeinWP The plugin is intended to create a real commenting community on your blog. What's more, when creating a Disqus account, the users will automatically receive notifications regarding replies to their comments, no matter what blog or site they are browsing. Threaded comments and replies Notifications and reply by email Subscribe and RSS options Aggregated comments and social mentions Powerful moderation and admin tools Full spam filtering, blacklists and whitelists *** Download QR-Code Epoch - A native Disqus alternative with a focus on speed and privacy Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: Turquemag and WPTavern Make use of this plugin to create a realtime chat experience on your WordPress site and improve your site's SEO performance at the same time. WordPress native comments Realtime with minimal server load Fully ajax commenting for both sending and receiving comments Front end moderation with realtime updates * * * Contact Form WordPress plugins Download QR-Code Contact Form 7 Developer: Takayuki Miyoshi Price: Free Installed on: MonsterPost, WPlift, ShoutMeLoud and WPDailyThemes Contact Form 7 allows you to get tons of comments and feedback from your readers. The clean code and detailed documentation make it easier for the developers to work with the plugin. It is rather simple, but still requires some minimal HTML knowledge from your side. Supports Ajax-powered submitting Includes CAPTCHA Akismet spam filtering *** Installed on: WPKube, WinningWP and WPBeginner This is an optimal solution to create your own, unique contact forms and share them on your site on the fly. With the pricing starting from $39 for 1 site and 1 year of support, Gravity Forms lets you create, add and edit your forms within your WordPress dashboard. You can even share your forms with the world by means of the shortcode that it automatically generated as you work. Create unlimited forms inside your WordPress site Make multi-page forms Schedule forms and restrict number of entries Create WordPress posts from entries Save forms and finish filling them out later Add-ons to integrate with payment platforms and more * * * Email WordPress Plugins Download QR-Code OptinMonster - Best WordPress Popup and Lead Generation Plugin Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: MonsterPost, WPMayor, FlyWheel, ShouMeLoud and CodeinWP In order to create highly converting forms, WordPress popups, floating headers, footer bars, etc. you will need to create an OptinMonster account first. The plugin is not free. Priced starting from $9/mo ($49/year), the plugin is intended to turn accidental visitors to your site or blog into your loyal readers by means of an easy-to-use subscription form. 8 types of optins: popup forms, floating bars, slide-ins, sidebar forms, after-post forms, in-line forms, mobile-only popup forms, and Canvas Seamless integration with all marketing services Advanced Page Level Targeting and Behavior Personalization A/B split testing In-depth conversion analytics, etc. *** Download QR-Code MailChimp for WordPress Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: Torquemag, WPMU Dev Blog, WinningWP and WPBeginner Use it to enhance your email marketing strategy. MailChimp boasts a great user interface, which allows you to manage subscribers, send emails, crate email templates, split test your campaigns, and do a whole lot of other things within one email marketing service. There is a free plan that includes about 2,000 subscribers and 12,000 emails per month. If you want to get more, you will need to go premium. Easy drag'n'drop interface to manage campaigns Marketing automation tool Built-in Google analytics Integration with SurveyMonkey, Google, Twitter, Facebook, Shopify, and more app and services *** Download QR-Code Peter's Collaboration E-mails Developer: Peter Price: Free Installed on: ShoutMeLoud and WPMU Dev Blog The plugin will be especially useful for guest blogging. For example, it will send automatic email notifications to guest writers regarding the guest post status (pending, scheduled or published). As a blog owner, you will receive automatic notifications about new guest post requests and the posts that have been already published on your web resource. Automated collaboration with guest authors The plugin sends emails to guest writers regarding the current status of their posts *** Installed on: WPLift and WPDailyThemes Use this email opt-in plugin to create customizable forms within your WordPress site and integrate those forms with the popular email marketing systems. The plugin provides with full control of when, where and how often your forms appear. Bloom is not free. The plans start from $69 per year. 6 different display types Automatic pop-up and fly-in triggers 100+ pre-made designs Targeted display settings * * * Social Media WordPress Plugins Download QR-Code Revive Old Post (Former Tweet Old Post) Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: WPLift, CodeinWP and WMPU Dev Blog Developed by: CodeinWP As the name implies, this social media plugin lets you keep your posts alive while sharing them on Facebook, Twitter and Linkedin with the purpose to drive more traffic from the popular social networks. Share new and old posts in social media Choose the time between posts and the number of posts to share Use hashtags to focus on topics Include links back to your site Exclude categories and specific posts *** Download QR-Code Click To Tweet Developer: CoSchedule Price: Free Installed on: CodeinWP and ShoutMeLoud Use it to add beautiful 'click to tweet' boxes anywhere on your site. Lets you create tweetable content with ease Includes the option to add pullquotes and custom messages inside the body of your posts in order to make it easier to the readers to find information that can be shared to Twitter * * * WordPress Plugins for Other Purposes Download QR-Code Yoast SEO Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: MonsterPost, WPKube, Torquemag, WPDailyThemes, ShoutMeLoud, WPSuperstars, CodeinWP, and WPlift Use this plugin to improve your site's SEO on all aspects needed. It forces you to focus on keywords while writing your content. In that way, you can optimize the SEO title, meta descriptions and the body of your posts in a way that each of them will contain a specific keyword. Includes Page Analysis to check if your content contains the focus keyword Allows you to take control of Meta and Link elements Import functionality for other WordPress SEO plugins Social media integration RSS optimization *** Download QR-Code Editorial Calendar Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: Torquemag and WPMU Dev Blog The management of blog publications will get way easier with this tool. Once integrated into your blog, you will have an overview of your blog publications all gathered in one easy to use environment. Manage posts from multiple authors See the status of posts, manage drafts and publish posts Change post publishing dates within a drag'n'drop interface *** Download QR-Code Roost Web Push Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: ShoutMeLoud and WPMU Dev This is a great solution to engage your readers with push notifications. Compatible with Chrome (Android and desktop) and Safari (desktop), it will keep them updated on the latest news from your blog. Chrome and Firefox notifications Category filters bbPress subscriptions Scheduled post notifications Detailed Analytics Plugins that are used by individual blogs Content Optimization WordPress Plugins >> Plugins to Preview Post Drafts >> Similar Posts WordPress Plugins >> Plugins for a More Effective Work with Authors >> Caching WordPress Plugins >> Social Media WordPress Plugins >> Productivity Optimization WordPress Plugins >> SEO Optimization WordPress Plugins >> Redirect WordPress Plugins >> WordPress Plugins to Manage Code >> Notifications WordPress Plugins >> Dashboard Management Plugins >> Email Service WordPress Plugins >> Security WordPress Plugins >> WordPress Plugins to Manage Commercials >> Plugins for Affiliate Marketing >> WordPress Plugins for Ready Made Forms >> WordPress Search Plugins >> Other... >> * * * Content Optimization WordPress Plugins Download QR-Code Drop Shadow Boxes Developer: stevehenty Price: Free Installed on: CodeinWP The plugin can be used to highlight the most important content in posts, on your blog pages and in widget area in a more visually pleasing manner. Drop shadow effects: raised, lifted, perspective The shadow is supported by the majority of web browsers A widget and shortcode builder with a preview are available *** Download QR-Code RICG Responsive Images Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: CodeinWP With this plugin installed, all images that you upload to your blog will automatically include all available image sizes, which ensures proper content display across a variety of the modern devices. Automatic resolution-switching Compatibility with WordPress version 4.4 *** Download QR-Code Shortcodes Ultimate Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: CodeinWP Even though it is available for free download, the functionality that it offers can bring it into the line with premium solutions. With its help you can save loads of time and effort on the creation of tabs, buttons, sliders, responsive videos, and so much more. 50+ shortcodes Shortcode Generator Fully responsive Multilingual and RTL support *** Download QR-Code ShortPixel Image Optimizer Developer: AlexSP Price: Free Installed on: CodeinWP Intended to make your site load faster by reducing the size of images, without compromising on their quality. The plugin optimizes both old and new images on your site. Bulk optimization option is available as well. Compatible with PNG, JPG, GIF (still and animated) and PDF Featured images and thumbnails are also optimized Bulk optimization with one click Free to use with 100 images per month, images optimized less than 5% are bonus *** Installed on: ShoutMeLoud This is a great option for busy bloggers who write their content in Microsoft Office and Google Docs. Having it integrated into your blog you can import all data from the latter (including images, bullet points, URLs, and post formatting) in a few seconds. On top of that, the plugin will automatically upload images into the media library. Supports .DOCX file format Imports up to 8 documents/month from your computer Standard Support that Works Rigorously This is what the Lite version of the plugin offers. If you wish, you can go premium and get the following options: Import unlimited amount of documents from PC, Google Docs or Dropbox One Year Priority Support & Updates *** Download QR-Code Responsive Lightbox by dFactory Developer: dFactory Price: Free Installed on: WPDailyThemes Use this plugin to provide the users of handheld devices with a more enjoyable experience of viewing larger versions of images, without compromising on their quality. 6 responsive lightbox scripts: SwipeBox, prettyPhoto, FancyBox, Nivo Lightbox, Image Lightbox, Tos "R" Us Automatically add lightbox to WordPress image galleries, WordPress image links, WordPress video links (YouTube, Vimeo) Highly customizable settings for each of the lightbox scripts Multisite support *** Download QR-Code upPrev Developer: Marcin Pietrzak Price: Free Installed on: WinningWP Use to display fly-out or fade box with related content. The latter can be chosen at random, by tag, previous in tag/category or just previously published post. The box is displayed at the bottom of the page Shows the previous or a randomly selected content *** Download QR-Code Title Experiments Free Developer: Jason Funk Price: Free Installed on: WPSuperstars Use it to increase click through rates while running A/B tests with multiple titles for a single blog post. Tests multiple versions of titles for pages/posts Counts the number of views and impressions of each title Shows a similar title to the returning customer *** Download QR-Code Optimizely Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: MonsterPost Use it to create catching headlines through A/B testing. The plugin allows you to create 6 different titles for each of your blog posts, which will change each other, so different groups of users will be introduced to a different title of your publication. The tool tracks which title is the most clickable and analyzes what factors made it so popular among the readers. In that way, you can come up with your own perfect formula of writing post titles. To use it you will need to create your own account at Optimizely.com A/B testing of blog posts Supports up to 6 different variants of titles for 1 post * * * Plugins to Preview Post Drafts Download QR-Code WP Product Review Lite Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: CodeinWP Developed by: CodeinWP The plugin is intended to make your posts more informative and diverse by means of pros/cons sections, ratings, affiliate links, user reviews, and so much more. Custom Review Icons Preloader functionality Unlimited Options PROs/ Cons *** Download QR-Code Share a Draft Developer: Nikolay Bachiyski Price: Free Installed on: WPMU Dev Blog As a rule, WordPress post drafts are visible only to the registered users, i.e. editors and blog administrators. While integrating this plugin into your blog, you will be able to show drafts of your posts to literally anyone you wish, without the need to create an account for him/her. Creates a unique link to a draft for a limited time Shows drafts to the users without registration in your blog's admin panel *** Download QR-Code Public Post Preview Developer: Dominik Schilling (ocean90) Price: Free Installed on: CodeinWP The plugin works pretty much similar to the previous one. Letting anonymous users to preview your posts before they are published. Anonymous post draft preview Generates an URL that expires once being given out for a public preview * * * Similar Posts WordPress Plugins Download QR-Code Contextual Related Posts Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: CodeinWP Coming with support for thumbnails, shortcodes, widgets, CSS styles, and more, the plugin is an optimal solution to display a list of related posts on your blog or in your feed. To provide the users with the content that would be of the greatest interest to your readers, it creates a list based on the content of titles and/or posts that are relevant to the ones a user has recently seen. Automatically caches the recently viewed content Related post are added to a widgetized area on your blog You can display the most popular posts anywhere on your site by means of shortcodes Supports the option to create custom post types *** Download QR-Code Popular Widget Developer: Hax Price: Free Installed on: CodeinWP As the name implies, you can use this plugin to display the most popular publications on your site. A tabbed widget allows you to filter all posts by categories or by date range. Set interval within which a post is considered as popular Filter posts by categories Calculate the number of visits and page views Display thumbnails *** Download QR-Code WordPress Popular Posts Developer: Hector Cabrera Price: Free Installed on: WPSuperstars The fully customizable plugin will showcase the most trending publications on your blog to the audience. By saying that it's fully customizable we mean that you can manage the way the most popular posts will be displayed: by the number of comments or views (per day or another period of time). WPML ready WordPress multisite support Multi-widget compatible Custom post type support * * * Plugins for a More Effective Work with Authors Download QR-Code WP Engine GeoIP Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: Torquemag Use it to display an author bio, photo and social media buttons at the button of each publication on your blog. Released under a GPL license Displays author bio, photo, social sharing options *** Download QR-Code Good Writer Checkify Developer: pythoPhpSteve Price: Free Installed on: WPMU Dev Blog The plugin was developed to enhance bloggers' writing techniques. If you are an experienced writer, the developers of this tool offer you to choose the top 10 of your most successful publications and pick a set of principles/techniques that you consider effective, and add those to the plugin's settings. Each time that you work on a new publication, the tool will check for the availability of the aforementioned techniques in your text. Add blogging guidelines to WordPress Set the number of words that make a post SEO friendly Fully customizable settings page *** Download QR-Code Post Pay Counter Developer: Ste_95 Price: Free Installed on: FlyWheel The plugin will be of great use to multi-author blogs. With its help a blog administrator can set criteria upon which payment should be computed (e.g. pay per word, post, visit, image, comment). All history and stats are automatically saved by the tool. Pay per incremental or zonal system Customize permissions in order to make stats (that the users are not supposed to see) invisible Personalize the users' settings No registration required *** Download QR-Code Author Avatars List Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: WPTavern Here is another great tool for multi-user blogs. With its help you can show lists of avatars somewhere on your blog, insert avatars into a post or page by using a shortcode. Show specific groups of authors Limit the number of avatars that are being displayed Group authors by their blog Show a user's name and bio (optionally) Manage the order in which authors will be displayed *** Download QR-Code CoSchedule Developer: CoSchedule Price: Free Installed on: WPSuperstars Use it to automate the publication of posts on your social media pages. While using a simple drag and drop editorial calendar, you can schedule blog posts and the corresponding social media messages at the same time. As soon as a blog post is re-scheduled, the social media post publication date is automatically switched. Create blog publications and social media messages within one interface Drag'n'drop editorial calendar The option to schedule social media while you blog Editorial comments Team workflow management * * * Caching WordPress Plugins Download QR-Code WP Super Cache Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: WPLift Use it to generate static HTML files and deliver those to 99% of your blog visitors while utilizing mod rewrite, legacy caching or PHP. The plugin is very easy to use. In order to activate it, just press Caching On in the Easy tag, and the tool will start caching your pages. Advanced settings area allows you to choose what type of caching you use files compression The option not to cache files for the known users Content delivery networks support Allows several more plugins to be loaded in WP Super Cache, i.e. Bad Behavior, the Jetpack Mobile Theme, and WPTouch *** Download QR-Code Sunny (Connecting CloudFlare and WordPress) Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: ShoutMeLoud Use it to clear CloudFlare cache each time you update a post and protect your blog in terms of DNS. Thanks to its intuitive drag and drop interface, you can manage the way social buttons will be displayed effortlessly. For developers, there is a template tag available for custom use cases. Displays icons that link visitors to your social media profiles You can easily choose which profile to link each icon to Customize the color and size of icons * * * Productivity Optimization WordPress Plugins Download QR-Code ManageWP Worker Developer: various Price: Free Installed on: WPLift Use it to manage all your WordPress sites in one simple dashboard. Gaming News PS4 Xbox One Nintendo PC Gaming Mobile Gaming What’s Hot Rumour Gameplay Guide Patch Tech News Mobile Tablet Desktop OS Tech Rumors Trending Anime Movies TV Series Entertainment Sports Social Media World News Contact Us The Bitbag Gaming News PS4 Xbox One Nintendo PC Gaming Mobile Gaming What’s Hot Rumors Gameplay Guide Patch Tech News Mobile Tablet Desktop OS Tech Rumors Trending Anime Movies TV Series Entertainment Sports Social Media World News Android Android 7.1.2 Nougat Update: Here Are The Phones Getting First Roll Out By Michael Jay Toledo on February 3 2017 03:53 PM Share Tweet Share Share Email On Monday, Google announced that Android Nougat 7.1.2 is already rolling out to their devices. Although it will only be available on their handsets, it will still be great to know what the inclusions of the update are. Here are the things to expect in Nougat 7.1.2. It can be recalled that back in November, consumers were asking why previous Nexus devices did not receive the “Swipe for notifications” gesture. At that time, Google said they were still “evaluating” the feature. But with the recent update, the feature has arrived on Nexus 5X. It is expected to be on Nexus 6P soon as well. The “swipe for notifications” allow users to swipe across the sensor to bring up their app alerts, instead of doing it on the device’s screen. For 5X users, you can see this under “Moves” in Settings. Aside from 5X, the update has also arrived on Pixel XL and Pixel XL Smartphones. As of writing, update 7.1.2 is only available for Google’s handsets. According to Express UK, Android Nougat 7.1.2 also includes redesigned app shortcuts and better image keyboard support. It has a size of 1.25 GB, so it will be more practical if you are connected to a Wi-Fi network before downloading the update. Details about the update’s arrival on other brands, however, are still not available. Hopefully, mainstream brands will disclose the information soon. Android Nougat 7.1.2 On Other Devices Most consumers know that it was Samsung just recently started launching Nougat 7.0 on their handsets. The update only arrived on Galaxy S7 and S7 Edge last month because the company had to test the software first. The main aim of the test was to fix any bug in the system, if there were any. This was also the case for HTC and Sony. Both companies tested Nougat first before rolling it out to their users. It gave them time as well to add some of their own apps, skins, and services in the system. Unfortunately, Samsung, HTC, and Sony seem to be testing 7.1.2 once more before releasing it. Consumers should expect it to be ready in the next few months. These are the latest news and rumors about Android Nougat 7.1.2 so far. Hopefully, it will arrive on other devices soon so no one will be left out. Share your thoughts in the comments section below. In the smartphone side of things, the Mountain View company's virtual assistant has been exclusive to the Pixel and Pixel XL, but talks about it going beyond the two aren't anything new, as the LG G6 has already been reported to feature it. Nexus 5X, Nexus 6P Major Update To Expand Google Assistant Devices This news comes from Stephen Hall of 9to5Google, and according to him, he was told about this bit included in the next major update. Was recently told that Assistant is finally coming to Nexus 5X/6P soon with next “major” update. — Stephen Hall (@hallstephenj) February 2, 2017 However, that's about it. There aren't that many details surrounding the topic just yet, but that shouldn't come as much of a surprise considering this is a rumor after all. On an interesting note, Google recently introduced the Android 7.1.2 beta to supported Nexus and Pixel devices, putting the factory images up for download too. This is probably not the major update that comes with Assistant, though, not to mention that it's not available for the Nexus 6P just yet, but who knows. More Devices Expected To Get Google Assistant Other Than Nexus 5X, Nexus 6P Aside from the LG G6, the new Nvidia Shield is also set to support Google Assistant sometime in the future. But what about the Nexus 6 and Nexus 9? Well, it's hard to say since they aren't even getting Android 7.1.2, which Google has already confirmed. For those who can't wait to tinker with Google's virtual assistant, there are already guides (via XDA-Developers) on how to have it up and running on Android 7.0 Nougat or higher devices, but it's not exactly for the faint of heart. Some Google Assistant Features To Look Forward To Back in January, the beta version of the Google App contained clues to some notable features that Assistant could offer, which came to light thanks to some users who dug through the codes. First off, it could have keyboard input and gesture support. Second, it could become capable of letting users make payments with voice commands. To boil things down, the Nexus 5X and Nexus 6P will likely get Google Assistant soon enough, but seeing as this is just a rumor at this point, it's better to take it with the proverbial grain of salt for now. Also, whether or not the major update is referring to Android 7.1.2, 7.1.3, 7.2, or even 8.0 — aka Android O — is unclear. Regardless, this is still a good sign that the AI is about to start making its way to more devices other than the Pixel and Pixel XL. Are you amped-up to have Google Assistant on your phone? If so, feel free to drop by our comments section below and let us know. TAG Nexus 5X, Nexus 6P, Android, Google, Google Assistant © 2016 Tech Times, All rights reserved. Computerworld Snap is paying Google $400M a year for cloud services News Technology News Business Cloud Computing Data Centre Gaming Dev Government Infrastructure Mobility Networking Open Source Security Servers Social Networking Software Software Development Storage Tech Planet Telecoms Tutorials Unified Comms Virtualisation Tools Blogs Editorial Contacts Events IT Media Releases Join Computerworld Newsletters NBN RSS Slideshows Vendor View Videos Zones Jobs Whitepapers All Whitepapers Business + Management Cloud Computing CRM Data Centre Data Management Disaster Recovery Network Security Storage Telecommunications Unified Communications Virtualisation Wireless Other Whitepapers Login Forgot password? Twitter Facebook Snap is paying Google $400M a year for cloud services Snap has agreed to a minimum annual cloud bill roughly equal to its 2016 revenue Blair Hanley Frank (IDG News Service) 03 February, 2017 16:16 - - - - print email Comments Over the next five years, the company behind Snapchat will pay Google at least US$2 billion in cloud bills. On Thursday, Snap revealed in a filing with the US Securities and Exchange Commission that it signed a five-year contract to pay Google at least $400 million a year for cloud services. That's a steep figure, considering that Snap made roughly $404 million last year.  In return for the massive commitment, Snap will receive reduced pricing, though it’s not clear how deep the company’s discounts will be. Sinking a bunch of money into Google Cloud makes sense, because Snapchat began its life built on top of Google’s AppEngine platform-as-a-service offering. Furthermore, Snap’s commitment to Google is a massive vote of confidence in the latter’s cloud capabilities, at a time when there’s heavy competition in the cloud market. Right now, Google’s cloud is an underdog compared to Microsoft and Amazon. But being tied to a rising star in the social media landscape like Snapchat could help draw other companies to at least give Google’s platform a chance. However, the contract is not without risk. If Snap doesn’t use $400 million worth of Google Cloud services in a year, it’s still on the hook for the full value of the contract. What’s more, the company said in the filing that it uses Google for the “vast majority” of its “computing, storage, bandwidth, and other services.” If something goes wrong with Google Cloud, or if the tech titan gets out of the public cloud business, it could be bad news for Snap. That last scenario seems highly unlikely, considering that Google continues increasing its investment in its cloud platform. Urs Hölzle, Google’s vice president of technical infrastructure, said last year that the company plans to launch new cloud data centers at the rate of roughly one each month this year. All of this is tied to Snap’s plans to pursue an initial public offering in the near future. The filing released on Thursday is one of the company’s steps along that path. Snap’s IPO is being closely observed by the tech industry because of the company’s high-flying status. It remains to be seen how Wall Street will receive the company, especially since it’s far from profitable and its losses have widened year over year. Plus, the deal with Google means that Snap will be saddled with hundreds of millions of dollars in liabilities for the foreseeable future. News Hardware Gaming Mobile Finance Reviews Deals Mobile LG Watch Style With Android Wear 2.0 Leaks In Images, Expected To Retail At $249 By Zara Ali Jan 30, 2017 13Shares Share Tweet Submit With Android Wear 2.0 just around the corner, LG is gearing up to bring in two Android Wear smartwatches. In one of his latest leak, Evan Blass took the wraps off LG’s Watch Style that is expected to ship with Google’s Android Wear 2.0. In the leaked pictures, the Watch Style can be seen in three color variants. In the leak, Evan Blass has just posted the pictures of the Watch Style. However, various rumors about the upcoming wearable suggest that it will feature a 1.2-inch P-OLED display with a resolution of 360 x 360 pixel. It will come with 4GB storage and 512MB of RAM. Also, the smartwatch will be dust and water resistant with the IP67 rating. A 240mAh will power the smartwatch. According to a report by Android Police, LG could price the Watch Style around $249. While LG has not confirmed any info regarding the upcoming smartwatch, but the sources suggest that it will have just one variant available in different colour options. LG had been one of the original partners for Google’s Android Wear program and LG’s G Watch was developed under Google’s guidelines. Advertisement Besides, LG is also working on other smartwatches as well. The other one is Watch Sport, which is rumored to come with better specs than the Watch Style. It is expected to feature a 1.38-inch display with a resolution of 480 x 480 pixel, 736MB of RAM, and IP68 rating. The Watch Sport will come with connectivity options such as LTE, NFC, and GPS. With the upgraded specs, the Watch Sport will most likely be priced higher than the Watch Style, around $100 more. The Watch Sport bears similar specifications as LG’s Watch Urbane second edition that was priced at $359.99 (for AT&T) and $449 (for Verizon). So, we could expect the starting price of the Watch Sport around $350 or more. Apple Garners 104% in Smartphone Profits – Other Android Phone Giants Struggling With Losses Regarding the launch of the new range of smartwatches by LG, Evan Blass tips that the company might unveil them ahead of MWC event, on February 9. Going by the design, the Watch Style and Watch Sport do look a little like Google’s upcoming smartwatches. We will get to see both the smartwatches in their glory when LG makes them official. Stay tuned with us for more info. Thailand Press Release News search General Business Entertainment IT Stcoks Lifestyle Telecom Energy Properties Automotive Heathcare Events ฝากข่าวประชาสัมพันธ์ Its 2017 And This Is Why Its Time for Your Online Tourism Marketing to Get Real General Press Releases Friday February 3, 2017 13:08 Bangkok--3 Feb--ScottAsia Communications Destinations, hotels and tourism businesses should seize the opportunities of digital democracy created by the semantic search revolution that has only just begun, says Bronwyn White, co-founder of MyTravelResearch.com, which is launching a free webinar series for tourism marketers WHEN Google switched its algorithm to semantic search in 2013 it began to clear away dodgy SEO practices and leveled the playing field for small operators and destinations. It made it easier for small businesses to create an honest strategy to rank well online in Google and the search engines. A few years on, the main outcome is that page one of a Google search will be different for every user, every location and every desktop or mobile device. Today, tourism businesses and destinations therefore have the opportunity to rank well for their ideal customer in Google's organic search results – as long as they commit to building online trust, reputation and authority over time. Relevance and trust are the new currencies in town. They have given travel businesses and destinations opportunities that we are unlikely to see again. It's like being at the beginning of time once more, a time when tourism businesses can not only survive online, but thrive. However, there's no quick fix. If you want to be on the first page of your ideal customer's Google search – as MyTravelResearch.com has done for the terms "travel research" in certain regions – you have to be consistent in your online marketing. This means consistency in branding and content marketing. Post relevant, good quality content and post often. To get results you have to be clear about who your customers are and have a well-defined brand that guides your visual choice and gives you a consistent tone of voice and messaging. The Five Steps Clear branding and customer targeting are the baselines. In addition, there are five steps you have to also take: 1) Make sure you're on Google My Business (it's free). 2) Ensure your site is mobile friendly (you can check here for free – and Google gives you tips how to make your site mobile compatible). 3) Realise that content is king. Create content that is useful, relevant and meaningful. Ensure quality over quantity 4) Make sure your web site and your social media platforms are soundly branded in terms of content, language and image choice. 5) Ramp up the number of images and videos you have on your site (Google loves this). For visual content don't think you need to spend big money on video production. You don't. Videos uploaded from smart phones are often deemed more 'authentic'. For example see "Whale of a Time" or "Who are Roo Looking At?" at http://www.news.com.au/travel/australian-holidays/tourism-australias-favourite-social-media-posts-of-2015/news-story/1ec3b7a4183886142db1cf5e5e474e66. Importantly, to achieve a strong online presence in the brave new world of semantic search all the above elements have to work together. Remember, travel related content is the most watched content on YouTube. In western countries people spend about 13 hours doing online research before making a travel purchase (22 hours in China). People everywhere are perplexed and overwhelmed by the abundance of digital marketing choice. If customers are confused by your brand, search engines will be too. So focus your online branding, messaging and be consistent. Turn the above insights into action and put an end to 'hope marketing'. The full Five-Step Tourism Marketing blog can be read at http://www.mytravelresearch.com/5-step-tourism-marketing-system/. * MyTravelResearch.com will launch free webinars where they teach destination marketing organisations and tourism businesses the methodology to successfully implement the five-step tourism marketing system. The webinars start 28 February. Find out more at http://www.mytravelresearch.com/5-step-tourism-marketing-system/. Collapse Expand Home Shop News Reviews Features Opinions Photos Videos Gadget Guru Cell Guru Prime Tech Smartphone Reviews Tech and Gadget Reviews How-To Videos Video Game Reviews and Features Top Lists by Gadgets 360 Unboxing and Hands-On Videos Hubs Apple Android BlackBerry Google Microsoft Nokia Samsung Sony Compare Mobiles Phone Finder DEALS Mobiles Tablets Apps Gaming Cameras PC/Laptops AUDIO/VIDEO How To Telecom Science INDIA INTERNET SOCIAL MEDIA WEARABLES हिंदी Home Apps Apps News Snap Files for $3 Billion IPO, Reveals Snapchat Has 158 Million Daily Active Users  Reuters, 03 February 2017 Share on Facebook Tweet Share Share Email Reddit Photo Credit: Bloomberg Snapchat owner Snap Inc shot the opening salvo in its $3 billion (roughly Rs. 20,212 crores) initial public offering on Thursday, outlining aggressive expansion plans but offering new investors no say on how the company is run and no promise of profits. Snap's publication on Thursday of its IPO registration document sets the stage for its upcoming marketing campaign to convince investors to look past its widening losses and the firm grip of its founders, and focus on its rapid growth of active users. The number of Snap's daily active users grew to an average of 158 million at the end of December, up 48 percent year-on-year, Snap revealed. However, its net loss widened to $514.6 million (roughly Rs. 3,467 crores) in 2016 from $372.9 million the year before. While Snap will have time to polish its marketing pitch in the run-up to the IPO planned for March, some analysts were taken aback that the company was just beginning to reap cash from its product. "What surprises me the most is that it is still very early days when it comes to Snap making money," said Rohit Kulkarni, managing director at private securities investment firm SharesPost. Snap had confidentially registered with the US Securities and Exchange Commission for an IPO late last year. It kept the filing under such tight wraps, even some of its IPO underwriters had not seen it prior to publication on Thursday, sources familiar with the matter previously told Reuters. Snap said in the IPO registration document published on Thursday it would become the first US company to go public with shares on offer not granting voting rights to stock market investors. Its founders, Evan Spiegel and Robert Murphy, will keep control of the company. Snap could be valued at between $20 billion to $25 billion (roughly Rs. 1,34,754 crores to Rs. 1,68,441 crores), according to sources familiar with the situation who asked not to be named because the matter is confidential. That would give the company the richest valuation in a US technology IPO since Facebook Inc. Snap, which launched itself in 2012 with an app that sends disappearing messages, rebranded itself last year as a camera company and started selling $130 video camera glasses. It generates the majority of its revenue from advertising, seeking to challenge the dominance of Internet giants such as Facebook and Alphabet Inc's Google. "The industry has been crying out for new advertising units" says Ian Schafer, founder and chairman of ad agency Deep Focus, referring to the tight hold Facebook and Google have on the digital advertising marketplace. In its IPO registration document, Snap cited Apple Inc, Google, Twitter Inc, Facebook and its photo-sharing platform Instagram as its competitors. Tight control Spiegel, the 26-year-old Snap co-founder, last year earned $503,205 in salary, with a $1 million bonus. Imran Khan, Snapchat's chief strategy officer whom it hired from investment bank Credit Suisse Group AG in 2014, earned $241,539 last year with a $5.2 million bonus. In 2015, Khan also received $145.3 million worth of Snap shares as a sign-up bonus. Spiegel and Murphy will maintain tight control over Snap's stock through a unique three-share class structure. The structure will give Spiegel and Murphy the right of 10 votes for every share. Existing investors will have one vote for each of their shares, while new investors will have no voting rights. Snap said it couldn't predict if the structure would "result in a lower trading price or greater fluctuations" in the stock. Keeping tight control is common in companies closely associated with their founders, who often prefer to grow their business without being questioned by a broad array of investors. Still, offering a class of stock with no votes in an IPO is unprecedented. Though the structure has drawn some criticism for not giving stock market investors the opportunity to have input, some people close to the company have argued that investors can "vote with their feet" by not buying into the IPO if they are not comfortable with the arrangements. "Investors have to decide, am I going to avail myself of the opportunity to buy the stock, and forget about the fact that somewhere down the road they are likely going to run into trouble?" said James McRitchie, an independent corporate governance activist who has pressed for more equal voting rights at companies including Facebook. Paying Google Snap had $404.5 million (roughly Rs. 2,725 crores) in sales in 2016, up from $58.7 million in 2015. However, it had adjusted losses before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization last year of $459 million, compared with $292.9 million in 2015. Snap's biggest losses stem from "hosting fees" which it pays to cloud computing companies such as Google to use their infrastructure for its data. It will pay Google $2 billion over the next five years to use its cloud computing services. Because Snapchat users rely heavily on data-heavy pictures and video, the cost of these service is high. Still, the proportion of the company's costs to its revenue has been declining. Its strategy has been to bargain for better hosting rates as its growing number of users buoys its negotiating leverage. "They are adding infrastructure ahead of growth, and that is why you have some front-loading of losses," said SharesPost's Kulkarni. Some companies such as Facebook have their own hosting platforms, though this model can be more costly. Facebook's Instagram, which recently introduced disappearing video content similar to Snapchat, had 600 million users as of late last year. Like Snapchat, Instagram sells advertising on its platform. Snap's aggressive expansion is reflected in its staff numbers. By the end of last year, it had increased its number of employees to 1,859 from 600 in 2015. Snap said it would use the proceeds from its IPO for general purposes, including working capital, operating expenses and capital expenditures. Snap said it will list on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker SNAP. Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs Group Inc, JPMorgan Chase & Co and Deutsche Bank AG are leading the offering as underwriters. © Thomson Reuters 2017 Tags: Snap, Snapchat, Snap IPO, Apps Uber CEO Quits Trump Advisory Group Amid Mounting Pressure Apple Keeps Lead in Slumping Tablet Market, Say IDC and Strategy Analytics Snap Files for $3 Billion IPO, Reveals Snapchat Has 158 Million Daily Active Users     Advertisement   In Mobiles and Tablets Latest Huawei Honor 8 Lite Intex Aqua Amaze+ Asus ZenFone 3S Max ZTE Blade A2 Plus Swipe Elite Power Lava X41+ Intex Cloud Q11 4G Intex Cloud Style 4G Lava A55 Lava A50 Vivo V5 Lite Vivo V5 Plus Micromax Vdeo 3 ZTE Hawkeye LG X300 Micromax Vdeo 4 Samsung Galaxy C7 Pro Samsung Galaxy J2 Ace Swipe Konnect Grand Huawei P8 Lite (2017) Popular Oppo A57 Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 Nokia 6 OnePlus 3T Lenovo P2 Google Pixel Google Pixel XL Motorola Moto Z Moto Z Play Lenovo K5 Note Xiaomi Redmi 3s HTC 10 Xiaomi Mi5 Galaxy J7 2016 Redmi Note 3 Micromax phones Samsung phones Android Phones Smartphones Google Phones Nokia Phones Vivo V5 Honor 6X Gadgets 360 Hindi अब एक नए अवतार में बिकेगा मोटोरोला मोटो एम स्मार्टफोन ऐप्पल भारत में आईफोन बनाने का काम अप्रैल के अंत तक करेगी शुरू व्हाट्सऐप के इन कमाल के फ़ीचर के बारे में ज़रूर जानना चाहेंगे आप Latest Videos 02:57 HTC Desire 10 Pro Review 02:40 Smartphones That Help You Take Better Selfies 02:30 360 Daily: Union Budget 2017's Tech Focus, Your Free Android VPN May Contain Malware, and More 01:17 Everything You Need to Know About UPI 02:27 360 Daily: H1-B Visa's Proposed Reform, Oppo A57 Launched, and More More Videos» OPINIONS ALL AUTHORS Gopal Sathe Cloud Kitchens Take the Risk Out of Trying New Places - and the Reward Rohan Naravane UPI Has an Identity Problem That's Stopping It From Taking Off Akhil Arora How I Learned to Buy Less and Live More Advertisement Recent Google to Let Android Users Pin Web Apps to App Drawer GoPro's Sales Resume Growth, but Still Miss Expectations Reliance Jio Tops Coverage in India, Airtel Tops 4G Speed: Report Tesla CEO Elon Musk to Meet US President Donald Trump on Immigration Ban Google Assistant Rumoured to Arrive on Nexus 5X, Nexus 6P Soon Amazon Says 'Bullish' on India Business, New Services in the Offing Moto M Grey Colour Variant to Go on Sale in India From Monday Sony Starts Rolling Out February Android Security Update Ahead of Google Sony Reports Loss Offset by PlayStation and Image Sensor Sales Nintendo Ignores India, Most of the World for Fire Emblem Heroes Launch More News TRENDING Nokia P1 Concept Render Leaked; Shows Front Fingerprint Scanner Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 2GB RAM Variant to Go on Sale in India Today Moto G5 Smartphone May Go on Sale Soon After MWC 2017 Reliance Jio Tops Coverage in India, Airtel Tops 4G Speed: Report Apple Set to Begin Making iPhones in India by April's End Oppo A57 With 16-Megapixel Front Camera to Go on Sale in India Today Everything You Need to Know about the H-1B Visas Uber CEO Quits Trump Advisory Group Amid Mounting Pressure Xiaomi Mi 6 Will Reportedly Sport an Underclocked Snapdragon 835 SoC Moto M Grey Colour Variant to Go on Sale in India From Monday Sitemaps Archives Advertise About Us Feedback Privacy Policy Terms & Conditions Complaint Redressal Careers Contact Us RSS Ethics Gadgets Hindi © Copyright Red Pixels Ventures Limited 2017. FIRSTPOST TECH2 FAKING NEWS फर्स्टपोस्ट हिंदी News & Analysis Reviews Startup Gaming Biztech Auto Videos TechFirstpost most commented Hacking into WhatsApp and Telegram is now easy thanks to network flaw By tech2 News Staff 18   Comments Samsung curved gaming monitor launched in India starting at Rs 35,000 By tech2 News Staff 3   Comments Microsoft’s stripped-down ‘Windows 10 Cloud’ could be a ChromeOS alternative in the making By tech2 News Staff 1   Comments Apple is building a custom ARM chip to handle low power tasks on future MacBooks: Report By tech2 News Staff 1   Comments Atomic clocks on navigation satellites by Isro and ESA are failing, and nobody has an explanation By tech2 News Staff 1   Comments more from #Snapchat Snap, the company behind Snapchat offers $3 billion initial public offering Sources point that Snap Inc has selected New York Stock Exchange for its IPO Millenials are not as addicted to social media as Generation X: Report Top Reviews Pixel XL (32GB) Editor rating : 8 Price: 67,000 iPhone 7 Plus (256GB) Editor rating : 8 Price: 92,000 ThinkPad X1 Carbon (Core i5-6300U) Editor rating : 8 Price: 106,000 XPS 13 Core i7 (Z560035HIN9) Editor rating : 8 Price: 133,000 Z2 Plus (4GB RAM/64GB) Editor rating : 7.5 Price: 19,999 You are here: Home > News & Analysis> Snap, the company behind Snapchat offers $3 billion initial public offering #Snapchat Image Credits: REUTERS 0   03 Feb 2017 , 11:19 Snapchat owner Snap Inc shot the opening salvo in its $3 billion initial public offering on Thursday, outlining aggressive expansion plans but offering new investors no say on how the company is run and no promise of profits. Snap’s publication on Thursday of its IPO registration document sets the stage for its upcoming marketing campaign to convince investors to look past its widening losses and the firm grip of its founders, and focus on its rapid growth of active users. The number of Snap’s daily active users grew to an average of 158 million at the end of December, up 48 percent year-on-year, Snap revealed. However, its net loss widened to $514.6 million in 2016 from $372.9 million the year before. While Snap will have time to polish its marketing pitch in the run-up to the IPO planned for March, some analysts were taken aback that the company was just beginning to reap cash from its product. “What surprises me the most is that it is still very early days when it comes to Snap making money,” said Rohit Kulkarni, managing director at private securities investment firm SharesPost. Snap had confidentially registered with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission for an IPO late last year. It kept the filing under such tight wraps, even some of its IPO underwriters had not seen it prior to publication on Thursday, sources familiar with the matter previously told Reuters. Snap said in the IPO registration document published on Thursday it would become the first U.S. company to go public with shares on offer not granting voting rights to stock market investors. Its founders, Evan Spiegel and Robert Murphy, will keep control of the company. Snap could be valued at between $20 billion to $25 billion, according to sources familiar with the situation who asked not to be named because the matter is confidential. That would give the company the richest valuation in a U.S. technology IPO since Facebook Inc. Snap, which launched itself in 2012 with an app that sends disappearing messages, rebranded itself last year as a camera company and started selling $130 video camera glasses. It generates the majority of its revenue from advertising, seeking to challenge the dominance of internet giants such as Facebook and Alphabet Inc’s Google. “The industry has been crying out for new advertising units” says Ian Schafer, founder and chairman of ad agency Deep Focus, referring to the tight hold Facebook and Google have on the digital advertising marketplace. In its IPO registration document, Snap cited Apple Inc, Google, Twitter Inc, Facebook and its photo-sharing platform Instagram as its competitors. Tight Control Spiegel, the 26-year-old Snap co-founder, last year earned $503,205 in salary, with a $1 million bonus. Imran Khan, Snapchat’s chief strategy officer whom it hired from investment bank Credit Suisse Group AG in 2014, earned $241,539 last year with a $5.2 million bonus. In 2015, Khan also received $145.3 million worth of Snap shares as a sign-up bonus. Spiegel and Murphy will maintain tight control over Snap’s stock through a unique three-share class structure. The structure will give Spiegel and Murphy the right of 10 votes for every share. Existing investors will have one vote for each of their shares, while new investors will have no voting rights. Snap said it couldn’t predict if the structure would “result in a lower trading price or greater fluctuations” in the stock. Keeping tight control is common in companies closely associated with their founders, who often prefer to grow their business without being questioned by a broad array of investors. Still, offering a class of stock with no votes in an IPO is unprecedented. Though the structure has drawn some criticism for not giving stock market investors the opportunity to have input, some people close to the company have argued that investors can “vote with their feet” by not buying into the IPO if they are not comfortable with the arrangements. “Investors have to decide, am I going to avail myself of the opportunity to buy the stock, and forget about the fact that somewhere down the road they are likely going to run into trouble?” said James McRitchie, an independent corporate governance activist who has pressed for more equal voting rights at companies including Facebook. Paying Google Snap had $404.5 million in sales in 2016, up from $58.7 million in 2015. However, it had adjusted losses before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization last year of $459 million, compared with $292.9 million in 2015.  Snap’s biggest losses stem from “hosting fees” which it pays to cloud computing companies such as Google to use their infrastructure for its data. It will pay Google $2 billion over the next five years to use its cloud computing services. Because Snapchat users rely heavily on data-heavy pictures and video, the cost of these service is high. Still, the proportion of the company’s costs to its revenue has been declining. Its strategy has been to bargain for better hosting rates as its growing number of users buoys its negotiating leverage. “They are adding infrastructure ahead of growth, and that is why you have some front-loading of losses,” said SharesPost’s Kulkarni. Some companies such as Facebook have their own hosting platforms, though this model can be more costly. Facebook’s Instagram, which recently introduced disappearing video content similar to Snapchat, had 600 million users as of late last year. Like Snapchat, Instagram sells advertising on its platform. Snap’s aggressive expansion is reflected in its staff numbers. By the end of last year, it had increased its number of employees to 1,859 from 600 in 2015. Snap said it would use the proceeds from its IPO for general purposes, including working capital, operating expenses and capital expenditures. Snap said it will list on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker SNAP. Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs Group Inc, JPMorgan Chase & Co and Deutsche Bank AG are leading the offering as underwriters. Reuters Tags: control, Evan Spiegel, Google, IPO, marketing, Robert Murphy, SEC, Snap, Snapchat, United States Also read Snap Inc to file for public IPO sometime later next week, says report Sources point that Snap Inc has selected New York Stock Exchange for its IPO X Recommended For You Sources point that Snap Inc has selected New York Stock Exchange for its IPO Millenials are not as addicted to social media as Generation X: Report Snap Inc to file for public IPO sometime later next week, says report Here is how to get started with Instagram Live as the company rolls it worldwide Subscribe to our newsletter GO You are Now Subscribed to our Newsletter - Stay Tuned !
